News.headline: Tyrique Hyde Recognised By LFE
News.short_description: Academy midfielder Tyrique Hyde has been recognised by the LFE (League Football Education) for his contribution this season.
News.description:
The midfielder was included in The "11" for making excellent football and academic progress, and also making a positive contribution at his football club.

Tyrique Hyde, who is currently on loan at National League South side Whitehawk FC, is a young player that has come through the Daggers youth system to make his first team debut this season after singing his first pro contract back in August 2016.

Tyrique made his first start for the club away at FC Halifax Town on Tuesday 15th November in a 2-1 defeat in the Emirates FA Cup, and made his full league debut against Solihull Moors on Saturday 17th December which ended in a thrilling 4-4 draw, where he also got his first goal for the Daggers.

The midfielder has nine appearances for the Daggers in total with the one goal to his name.
